newsitem.title: POLAND: Rolimpex revises fats-firm Kruszwica bid.
newsitem.headline: Rolimpex revises fats-firm Kruszwica bid.

text.p: Polish food trader Rolimpex has revised its bid for a strategic stake in the edible-fats maker Kruszwica SA, currently held by the treasury ministry, Rolimpex's spokesman said on Friday.
The treasury, which last month offered the public up to 25 percent of Kruszwica at 25 zlotys a share, is seeking a strategic investor for a 40-percent stake in the company.
"We've revised our bid but I can't give any details and I don't know if our new offer will be taken into consideration," Bohdan Gornicki told Reuters.
Earlier this month Kruszwica's president told a news conference that the treasury ministry had shortlisted bidders for the stake and was likely to pick one investor by the end of the first quarter.
The stock closed on Thursday at 25 zlotys on the main market of the Warsaw bourse.
Last month food trader and producer Agros SA, said it was interested in a 40-percent stake in Kruszwica.
On Friday the daily Rzeczpospolita said Agros and a third unnamed foreign bidder had the best chance for the stake, but did not quote any sources.
Kruszwica expects to make a net profit of 5.4 million zlotys in 1996 and 10.5 million zlotys in 1997.
It expects sales of 472 million zlotys in 1996 and 550.5 million in 1997.
